quote: Stay hungry. Stay foolish.
author: Steve Jobs
context: Closing line, Stanford Commencement Address, 2005

quote: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life.
author: Steve Jobs
context: Stanford Commencement Address, 2005

quote: If other people are putting in 40 hour workweeks and you're putting in 100 hour workweeks, then even if you're doing the same thing … you will achieve in four months what it takes them a year to achieve.
author: Elon Musk
context: Advice on intense work-hours (public interviews / tweets summarised in press)

quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world.
author: Albert Einstein
context: Widely quoted remark on creativity vs. rote facts

quote: Let the future tell the truth, and evaluate each one according to his work and accomplishments. The present is theirs; the future, for which I really worked, is mine.
author: Nikola Tesla
context: On legacy and future impact

quote: If I have seen further it is by standing on the shoulders of giants.
author: Isaac Newton
context: Letter to Robert Hooke, 1675 — humility about building on prior work

quote: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
author: Linus Torvalds
context: Practical engineering ethos — prefer working examples over rhetoric

quote: Sometimes, the elegant implementation is just a function. Not a method. Not a class. Not a framework. Just a function.
author: John Carmack
context: Pragmatic advice about simplicity in code design

quote: It's easier to ask forgiveness than it is to get permission.
author: Grace Hopper
context: Attributed to Hopper — encouragement to move boldly at times

quote: We can only see a short distance ahead, but we can see plenty there that needs to be done.
author: Alan Turing
context: On limited foresight but plenty of work remaining (from Computing Machinery and Intelligence / contemporaneous writings)

quote: The cosmos is within us. We are made of star-stuff. We are a way for the universe to know itself.
author: Carl Sagan
context: Cosmos (1980) — poetic science perspective

quote: I would rather have questions that can't be answered than answers that can't be questioned.
author: (often attributed to) Richard Feynman
context: Epistemic humility — skepticism, scientific inquiry (see attribution notes)

quote: Always deliver more than expected.
author: Larry Page
context: Founding / product ethos attributed to Larry Page

quote: Solving big problems is easier than solving little problems.
author: Sergey Brin
context: On tackling ambitious problems (attributed to Brin)

quote: Work hard. Have fun. Make history.
author: Jeff Bezos
context: Amazon founding / cultural motto frequently quoted in Bezos collections

quote: Your most unhappy customers are your greatest source of learning.
author: Bill Gates
context: Product & feedback philosophy

quote: Move fast and break things. Unless you are breaking stuff, you are not moving fast enough.
author: Mark Zuckerberg
context: Early Facebook motto / the 'hacker way' (used in investor materials and speeches)

quote: There was no choice but to be pioneers.
author: Margaret Hamilton
context: Recounting Apollo-era software engineering and the birth of 'software engineering'

quote: We used to look up at the sky and wonder at our place in the stars. Now we just look down and worry about our place in the dirt.
author: Joseph Cooper (film character), Interstellar
context: Interstellar — inspirational line about human destiny

quote: Love is the one thing we're capable of perceiving that transcends dimensions of time and space.
author: Dr. Amelia Brand (film character), Interstellar
context: Interstellar — philosophical line used poignantly in the movie

quote: We've always defined ourselves by the ability to overcome the impossible.
author: Joseph Cooper (film character), Interstellar
context: Interstellar — resilience / human endeavor line

quote: All that is valuable in human society depends upon the opportunity for development accorded the individual.
author: Albert Einstein
context: On the value of individual development in society

quote: The only way to discover the limits of the possible is to go beyond them into the impossible.
author: Arthur C. Clarke
context: Classic sci-fi inspirational line (fits tech/space mindset)

quote: The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing.
author: Albert Einstein
context: On curiosity as a driver of science

quote: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
author: George Bernard Shaw
context: From Man and Superman — on the nature of progress
